info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Charleston WV
info.description:
At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Charleston, moving east at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Charleston, South Charleston, Dunbar, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Pratt, Coal Fork, and Handley.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 101. Interstate 64 in West Virginia mile marker 54 and near mile marker 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 83 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 71 and 80.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams, and ponding of water in urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas and low lying spots.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL KANAWHA COUNTY THROUGH 715 PM EDT
